Waterways and Other Bodies of Water

block.p: Monet's 1904 painting ''Waterloo Bridge, Temps Couvert,'' sold last night for $31.7 million, before commission, at Christie's International in London, Bloomberg News reported. The price was twice the estimate, but another Monet, ''Les Arceaux des Roses, Giverny,'' painted in 1913, fetched only $15.9 million, short of the $17.8 million estimate. ''Waterloo Bride,'' once owned by the filmmaker Alexander Korda, was bought by a telephone bidder; ''Roses,'' from a New York collection, went to an unidentified buyer in the auction room. The Monet auction record is $39.2 million, including commission. The sale ushered in a week of London auctions.
Monet’s 1904 painting “Waterloo Bridge, Temps Couvert,” sold last night for $31.7 million, before commission, at Christie’s International in London, Bloomberg News reported.

Monet's 1904 painting ''Waterloo Bridge, Temps Couvert,'' sold last night for $31.7 million, before commission, at Christie's International in London, Bloomberg News reported. The price was twice the estimate, but another Monet, ''Les Arceaux des Roses, Giverny,'' painted in 1913, fetched only $15.9 million, short of the $17.8 million estimate. ''Waterloo Bride,'' once owned by the filmmaker Alexander Korda, was bought by a telephone bidder; ''Roses,'' from a New York collection, went to an unidentified buyer in the auction room. The Monet auction record is $39.2 million, including commission. The sale ushered in a week of London auctions. ARTS, BRIEFLY
